AD_MageHandKid02PlayingShove.synopsis: Two gith kids are playing shove with Mage Hands, pushing around a chest. From inside the chest can be heard child-like screams.
AD_MageHandKid02PlayingShove.how_to_trigger: Plays automatically when Kid02 uses a shove.

AD_KidsFleeTrainingRoom.synopsis: The kids start running away and shout that they are following the protocol for when a fight happens in the creche.Only the main kid says a line since they disappear pretty quickly and there likely won't be time for two lines. The shorter the better.
AD_KidsFleeTrainingRoom.how_to_trigger: Plays automatically when the player starts a fight in the training room when the kids are around.

AD_LaezelPlayersAttackUnprovoked.synopsis: Laezel is warning the player to not mess around with the gith in this Creche.
AD_LaezelPlayersAttackUnprovoked.how_to_trigger: Triggers if the players start a fight against gith in the Creche unprovoked.

AD_CorridorTeens.synopsis: Two githyanki teenagers discuss the inquisitor when the player approaches them in the corridor.

AD_InfirmaryGuard04AfterKillingGremishka.synopsis: Line for one of the guards to say as they are going back to their post after killing the gremishka.
AD_InfirmaryGuard04AfterKillingGremishka.how_to_trigger: Triggers automatically after the combat with the Gremishka if the guards dealt with it on their own.

PAD_PlayerSurprisedAtGremishka.synopsis: The player is surprised by a gremishka (angry magical hairless cat-like creature)  that jumps out of a chest some gith kids are pushing around with Mage Hand in the gith crèche.
PAD_PlayerSurprisedAtGremishka.how_to_trigger: Happens when the gremishka breaks out of the chest.

AD_MageHandGremishkaCries.synopsis: Two gith kids are playing shove with Mage Hands pushing around a chest. From the inside of it are heard screams sounding like a child.The gremishka sounds just like a baby crying.
AD_MageHandGremishkaCries.how_to_trigger: Plays automatically when the box with the gremishka is hit.

WB_KidWipingPortrait.synopsis: The GIth boy is cleaning the Vandalised / Vandalised_Failed portrait, trying to wipe it off desperatedly. The animation loops endlessly.
WB_KidWipingPortrait.how_to_trigger: Load up CRE_Main_Ago to 1330; -2; -794go into stealth, and make sure no one notices as you interact with the portrait on the wallchoose to vandalise itafter the dialog has ended the gith boy will react with this world behaviour

VlaakithPortrait.synopsis: The player can attempt to vandalize the portrait and can be caught by a nearby gith teenager.
VlaakithPortrait.how_to_trigger: Interact with the Vlaakith portrait in the corridor

AD_MageHandGremishkaBoxStuck.synopsis: Kids comment that the box is now stuck.
AD_MageHandGremishkaBoxStuck.how_to_trigger: Plays if the player gets the Gremishka box stuck by moving it while the kids are still shoving it.

MageHandMain.synopsis: Two gith kids are pushing a chest (which secretly contains a gremishka) back and forth between them using their Mage Hands. You can tell them to stop and if you insist, eventually they'll step back from the box, letting the gremishka break out. Alternatively, if you try to join in or fail to get them to stop, they'll start shoving you.
MageHandMain.how_to_trigger: Speak to one of the kids while they are shoving the chest.

AD_PortraitKidReaction.synopsis: The portrait kid freaks out at the sight of the vandalised Vlaakith portrait.
AD_PortraitKidReaction.how_to_trigger: Go to 1330; -2; -794 and interact with the portrait. Choose to vandalise it.When the dialog ends, the kid will walk over and play the AD.

AD_MageHandKid01PlayingShove.synopsis: Two gith kids are playing shove with Mage Hands, pushing around a chest. From inside the chest can be heard child-like screams.
AD_MageHandKid01PlayingShove.how_to_trigger: Plays automatically when Kid01 uses a shove.

CorridorTeenagers.synopsis: The player has the chance to talk to a couple of chatty - but wary - gith youths in a corridor in the creche. They establish the fear around the inquisition.
CorridorTeenagers.how_to_trigger: Approach the gith youths at 1352; 0; -798 on CRE_Main_A and start a dialog with them.

AD_InfirmaryGuard04ReactionToGremishka.synopsis: The gith voicing his intent to attack the gremishka that spawned from the box.
AD_InfirmaryGuard04ReactionToGremishka.how_to_trigger: Plays when the Gremishka escapes from the chest if the S_CRE_InfirmaryAmbushGuard04 is nearby and available.

PAD_FoodComment.synopsis: If Lae'zel or GITH avatar is present they react to interacting with the apple crate in the corridor. If they aren't present, some other party character reacts with generic comment.
PAD_FoodComment.how_to_trigger: Load up CRE_Main_AGo to 1382; -2; -796Interact with the apple crate, and then close it.

PAD_RulesPoster.synopsis: If Lae'zel or GITH avatar is present they react to interacting with the rules poster in the Dorms. If they aren't present, some other party character reacts with generic comment.
PAD_RulesPoster.how_to_trigger: Load up CRE_Main_AGo to 1300; -2; -809interact with the parchment on the wall

AD_KidsFleeDormitory.synopsis: The kids start running away and shout that they are following the protocol for when a fight happens in the creche.Only the main kid says a line since they disappear pretty quickly and there likely won't be time for two lines. The shorter the better.
AD_KidsFleeDormitory.how_to_trigger: Plays automatically when the player starts a fight in the dormitory when the kids are around.

PAD_DormitoryComment.synopsis: If Lae'zel or GITH avatar is present they react to entering the dorms in the creche. If they aren't present, some other party character reacts with generic comment.
PAD_DormitoryComment.how_to_trigger: load up CRE_Main_Ago to 1313; -2; -824the AD will play

AD_VlaakithPortraitVandalized.how_to_trigger: Interact with Vlaakith's portrait after vandalizing it.

AD_MageHandKidLaughingAtPlayer.synopsis: Gith kid comments about the gremishka coming out of the chest.
AD_MageHandKidLaughingAtPlayer.how_to_trigger: Unlock the Mage Hand kids' chest or use a spell near it.

AD_CaptainGuardChatter.synopsis: Captain guard chatting to one of the patrolling guards.
AD_CaptainGuardChatter.how_to_trigger: Plays automatically for while the captain guard is not guarding the door, after the player has dealt with the Zaithisk.

AD_MageHandKid02PlayingShove_1.speaker: Ra'jak
AD_MageHandKid02PlayingShove_1.text: This one's gonna be good. I can feel it.
AD_MageHandKid02PlayingShove_1.context: NodeContext: Straining; this isn't easy for him

AD_MageHandKid02PlayingShove_2.speaker: Ra'jak
AD_MageHandKid02PlayingShove_2.text: Come on, Ra'jak - even further this time.

AD_MageHandKid02PlayingShove_3.speaker: Ra'jak
AD_MageHandKid02PlayingShove_3.text: I don't like it, Zel'i. It doesn't feel right...

AD_KidsFleeTrainingRoom_0.speaker: Kyr'das
AD_KidsFleeTrainingRoom_0.text: A fight! Time to follow protocol...

AD_LaezelPlayersAttackUnprovoked_1.speaker: Lae'zel
AD_LaezelPlayersAttackUnprovoked_1.text: Don't be foolish. Provoke these githyanki, and they will crush your skulls into powder.

AD_LaezelPlayersAttackUnprovoked_0.speaker: Lae'zel
AD_LaezelPlayersAttackUnprovoked_0.text: Provoke me, and I won't hesitate to join them.

AD_CorridorTeens_0.speaker: Youth Qun'irel
AD_CorridorTeens_0.text: I heard they're making us join the patrols soon. The search must be going badly.
AD_CorridorTeens_0.context: InternalNodeContext: panicking, seeking reassurance that she's wrongNodeContext: Hushed, doesn't want to be overheard

AD_CorridorTeens_1.speaker: Youth Tra'an
AD_CorridorTeens_1.context: InternalNodeContext: Silencing her, doesn't want to get in troubleNodeContext: hushed tones;

AD_InfirmaryGuard04AfterKillingGremishka.speaker: Youth Pyrindath
AD_InfirmaryGuard04AfterKillingGremishka.text: Rotten thing. Barely worth the fight.

PAD_PlayerSurprisedAtGremishka_1.speaker: Player
PAD_PlayerSurprisedAtGremishka_1.text: That's what was in there? Those little shits.

VlaakithPortrait_9.speaker: Narrator
VlaakithPortrait_9.text: *The portrait looks down on you - as if you were little more than an insect.*

VlaakithPortrait_13.speaker: Narrator
VlaakithPortrait_13.text: *You stand before a truly resplendent portrait of Queen Vlaakith in all her glory.*
VlaakithPortrait_13.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot of the portrait of Vlaakith

VlaakithPortrait_53.speaker: Lae'zel
VlaakithPortrait_53.text: Vlaakith herself. She is both the sun that blinds us and the void that contains us. Praise be.

VlaakithPortrait_24.speaker: Narrator
VlaakithPortrait_24.text: *In the corner of the painting is a small symbol you can't quite place.*
VlaakithPortrait_24.context: CinematicNodeContext: Pan down to shot of the symbol

VlaakithPortrait_55.speaker: Narrator
VlaakithPortrait_55.text: *This githyanki looks different from the others you've seen here.*

VlaakithPortrait_40.speaker: Narrator
VlaakithPortrait_40.text: *The way her stark white skin stretches over her sharp features gives her a distinctly otherworldly aspect.*

VlaakithPortrait_3.speaker: Narrator
VlaakithPortrait_3.text: *That face, that expression, brimming with might and glory.*

VlaakithPortrait_52.speaker: Narrator
VlaakithPortrait_52.text: *Her power and beauty are beyond words.*

VlaakithPortrait_43.speaker: Narrator
VlaakithPortrait_43.text: *You remember seeing this symbol in a book about the denizens of the Astral Plane.*

VlaakithPortrait_32.speaker: Narrator
VlaakithPortrait_32.text: *It appears to be a depiction of a comet.*

VlaakithPortrait_21.speaker: Narrator
VlaakithPortrait_21.text: *As hard as you rack your brain, the symbol doesn't look like anything you've seen before.*

VlaakithPortrait_6.speaker: Narrator
VlaakithPortrait_6.text: *You recall stories of a prince riding a comet just like this one.*

VlaakithPortrait_19.speaker: Narrator
VlaakithPortrait_19.text: *With sudden clarity, you realise it's the symbol of Orpheus - a forgotten hero from the tales of your youth.*

VlaakithPortrait_37.speaker: Lae'zel
VlaakithPortrait_37.text: The sign of Orpheus. Centuries gone, yet his influence stretches across the planes.

VlaakithPortrait_28.speaker: Lae'zel
VlaakithPortrait_28.text: Blasphemy, to scrawl it here. And a colossal risk.

VlaakithPortrait_46.speaker: Lae'zel
VlaakithPortrait_46.text: The sign of Orpheus? Blasphemy. Would I could quarter the vandal myself.

VlaakithPortrait_2.speaker: Player
VlaakithPortrait_2.text: Draw a new face onto the portrait.

VlaakithPortrait_5.speaker: Narrator
VlaakithPortrait_5.text: *You take a moment to fully appreciate your masterpiece.*
VlaakithPortrait_5.context:
CinematicNodeContext: The camera faces the player from the direction of the painting as they draw on the portrait (unseen off camera).
After this, a shot of now drawn-on portrait is shown.

VlaakithPortrait_35.speaker: Narrator
VlaakithPortrait_35.text: *She certainly looks a little less regal now.*

VlaakithPortrait_62.speaker: Lae'zel
VlaakithPortrait_62.text: A wretched display. I thought you better than such juvenile antics.

VlaakithPortrait_30.speaker: Lae'zel
VlaakithPortrait_30.text: Pathetic and profane. You've the brain of a child.

VlaakithPortrait_45.speaker: Narrator
VlaakithPortrait_45.text: *The prickle of transgression wrestles with your amusement at your own handiwork.*

VlaakithPortrait_48.speaker: Lae'zel
VlaakithPortrait_48.text: Kainyank! I should take your head for such blasphemy. But I'll save the pleasure for Vlaakith herself.

VlaakithPortrait_58.speaker: Narrator
VlaakithPortrait_58.text: *Just as you find your flow, you slip.*
VlaakithPortrait_58.context:
CinematicNodeContext: The camera faces the player from the direction of the painting as they draw on the portrait (unseen off camera).
Partway through drawing, the player slips erratically, stopping suddenly and pulling a panicked face as a result

VlaakithPortrait_10.speaker: Youth Vis'kiir
VlaakithPortrait_10.text: What did you do? The queen! Her face! Vlaakith m' zath'ak!
VlaakithPortrait_10.context: InternalNodeContext: VLAH-kith mm zah-THOCK (means "abomination to Vlaakith")NodeContext: Panicked

VlaakithPortrait_11.speaker: Youth Vis'kiir
VlaakithPortrait_11.text: Get out of here, hshar'lak! I need to clean this off before they see or we're all going to suffer for it.
VlaakithPortrait_11.context: InternalNodeContext: h-SHAR-lack (means "traitor")NodeContext: Panicked/angry at the player

VlaakithPortrait_44.speaker: Narrator
VlaakithPortrait_44.text: *Perhaps you should leave, before someone notices.*

VlaakithPortrait_18.speaker: Narrator
VlaakithPortrait_18.text: *This imposing portrait depicts a powerful githyanki warrior, undeniably regal in her mien.*
VlaakithPortrait_18.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot of the portrait of Vlaakith

AD_MageHandGremishkaBoxStuck_2.speaker: Ra'jak
AD_MageHandGremishkaBoxStuck_2.text: Aww... and I was having fun...

AD_MageHandGremishkaBoxStuck_1.speaker: Ra'jak
AD_MageHandGremishkaBoxStuck_1.text: Awww... you got it stuck. What am I going to play with now...

AD_MageHandGremishkaBoxStuck_3.speaker: Zel'i
AD_MageHandGremishkaBoxStuck_3.text: Idiot! You've got it stuck! Now I can't play with it anymore!

MageHandMain_26.speaker: Player
MageHandMain_26.text: You're going to pay for that!

MageHandMain_40.speaker: Zel'i
MageHandMain_40.text: What, you're going to beat us up? Oooh please don't hurt us.

MageHandMain_0.speaker: Player
MageHandMain_0.text: I'll show you the meaning of fear, you snivelling little toe-rags.

MageHandMain_22.speaker: Zel'i
MageHandMain_22.text: No need to be mean. We can be nice, can't we Ra'jak?
MageHandMain_22.context: NodeContext: with a smile - are you thinking what I'm thinking

MageHandMain_19.speaker: Ra'jak
MageHandMain_19.text: We'll share our box with you, how about that?
MageHandMain_19.context: NodeContext: with a smile - knows the danger hidden in the box

MageHandMain_29.speaker: Zel'i
MageHandMain_29.text: Take a look. We don't mind.
MageHandMain_29.context: NodeContext: With a smile. This should be fun.

MageHandMain_25.speaker: Player
MageHandMain_25.text: By the gods, you're annoying. Just pack it in, will you?

MageHandMain_46.speaker: Zel'i
MageHandMain_46.context: NodeContext: Pretending to think about it.

MageHandMain_34.speaker: Zel'i
MageHandMain_34.text: Where are you going? I thought you wanted to play?

MageHandMain_38.speaker: Player
MageHandMain_38.text: That's enough. You need to stop.

MageHandMain_35.speaker: Player
MageHandMain_35.text: I thought I told you to stop doing that?

MageHandMain_14.speaker: Ra'jak
MageHandMain_14.context: NodeContext: child snickering to herself with glee

MageHandMain_15.speaker: Zel'i
MageHandMain_15.text: You again? Leave us alone, k'chakhi!
MageHandMain_15.context: InternalNodeContext: ke-CHOCK-ee (means "idiot")NodeContext: Irritated at the player's interruption of their game

MageHandMain_18.speaker: Zel'i
MageHandMain_18.context: InternalNodeContext: ke-CHOCK-ee (means "idiot")NodeContext: Irritated at the player's interruption of their game

MageHandMain_7.speaker: Player
MageHandMain_7.text: What's in the chest? It's making an awful noise.

MageHandMain_1.speaker: Player
MageHandMain_1.text: Whatever it is, I think you should stop. It's clearly not having a good time.

MageHandMain_21.speaker: Zel'i
MageHandMain_21.context: NodeContext: Mock contemplative - then extremely gleeful in saying "no"

MageHandMain_23.speaker: Player
MageHandMain_23.text: Hmm - yes. Stop it. Let that thing out.

MageHandMain_9.speaker: Player
MageHandMain_9.text: Look here you little shits, I said STOP.

MageHandMain_3.speaker: Player
MageHandMain_3.text: Children - cease this impudence at ONCE.

MageHandMain_47.speaker: Zel'i
MageHandMain_47.text: Fiiiiine. If you're going to be a big baby about it.

MageHandMain_8.speaker: Zel'i
MageHandMain_8.text: Open it up then! It's all yours.
MageHandMain_8.context: InternalNodeContext: kid snickering to himself because he knows there's a wild gremishka inside that will attack the player

MageHandMain_28.speaker: Zel'i
MageHandMain_28.text: Urgh. You're boooring. Come on Ra'jak, let's show them how to have some FUN.
MageHandMain_28.context: NodeContext: with a malicious knowing little smirk

MageHandMain_24.speaker: Ra'jak
MageHandMain_24.context: NodeContext: Raj'ak shares in Zel'i's mischief

MageHandMain_16.speaker: Player
MageHandMain_16.text: Stupid kids. Utter waste of time.

MageHandMain_31.speaker: Zel'i
MageHandMain_31.text: At least we're not boring like YOU.

MageHandMain_43.speaker: Player
MageHandMain_43.text: If you won't stop, then I want in. How do I play?

MageHandMain_4.speaker: Zel'i
MageHandMain_4.text: Hear that, Ra'jak? They want in!
MageHandMain_4.context: InternalNodeContext: Scheming about how they're going to shove the player. NodeContext: pretending to humour the player, but really mocking

MageHandMain_39.speaker: Ra'jak
MageHandMain_39.context: InternalNodeContext: Ra'jak gets what Zel'i is implying and is in. NodeContext: with delighted malice

MageHandMain_32.speaker: Zel'i
MageHandMain_32.text: Ooo, the istik wants to play. What do you say, Ra'jak, shall we play with the istik?
MageHandMain_32.context: InternalNodeContext: Iss-tick (means "stranger"). By 'play', Zel'i means that he and Ra'jak will shove the player,NodeContext: full of mockery

MageHandMain_44.speaker: Player
MageHandMain_44.text: Whatever. I've got better things to do.

MageHandMain_33.speaker: Player
MageHandMain_33.text: You should stop doing that. It's not nice.

MageHandMain_20.speaker: Player
MageHandMain_20.text: Looks like fun - can I play?

AD_PortraitKidReaction_0.speaker: Youth Vis'kiir
AD_PortraitKidReaction_0.text: Oh, tsk'va, what did you do? What did you do?!
AD_PortraitKidReaction_0.context: InternalNodeContext: tsk-VA (means "shit")NodeContext: Panicked at the player-vandalized portrait (slightly angry as they saw the player do it)

AD_PortraitKidReaction_1.speaker: Youth Vis'kiir
AD_PortraitKidReaction_1.text: What is this? Tsk'va! I need to get rid of it before the Inquisitor sees!
AD_PortraitKidReaction_1.context: InternalNodeContext: tsk-VA (means "shit")NodeContext: Panicked at the player-vandalized portrait

AD_MageHandKid01PlayingShove_1.speaker: Zel'i
AD_MageHandKid01PlayingShove_1.context: NodeContext: Excitable (but slightly annoyed in case he's not actually watching)

AD_MageHandKid01PlayingShove_2.speaker: Zel'i
AD_MageHandKid01PlayingShove_2.text: Whoa, that was intense. Again, again!

CorridorTeenagers_1.speaker: Youth Tra'an
CorridorTeenagers_1.text: If you have news to discuss with the ch'r'ai, head down the corridor to the eastern wing.

CorridorTeenagers_2.speaker: Youth Qun'irel
CorridorTeenagers_2.text: What if they don't find the weapon? Do we even know it -
CorridorTeenagers_2.context: CinematicNodeContext: Speaking urgently with Tra'anNodeContext: Hushed, urgent

CorridorTeenagers_19.speaker: Youth Qun'irel
CorridorTeenagers_19.text: Forgive me, jhe'stil. I wasn't complaining. I'm honoured to help search -
CorridorTeenagers_19.context: CinematicNodeContext: Realises the player is listeningNodeContext: Panicked

CorridorTeenagers_35.speaker: Youth Tra'an
CorridorTeenagers_35.text: Qun'irel! Look at them. They're clearly not with the Inquisition.
CorridorTeenagers_35.context: InternalNodeContext: To the other gith (Qun'irel)NodeContext: Snapping the name but then cautious/defensive towards the player

CorridorTeenagers_44.speaker: Player
CorridorTeenagers_44.text: And I'm not here to harm you, either. Can you tell me more?

CorridorTeenagers_18.speaker: Player
CorridorTeenagers_18.text: Inquisition? What are you talking about?

CorridorTeenagers_6.speaker: Youth Qun'irel
CorridorTeenagers_6.text: Our queen's eyes and ears. They're her will, incarnate. And right now, they're here.
CorridorTeenagers_6.context: NodeContext: Hushed tone -  combination of fear and awe

CorridorTeenagers_38.speaker: Player
CorridorTeenagers_38.text: At ease. I'm just looking for your captain.

CorridorTeenagers_30.speaker: Youth Tra'an
CorridorTeenagers_30.text: See? I told you. Nothing to worry about.
CorridorTeenagers_30.context: NodeContext: A little confused - but slightly excited on the second sentence

CorridorTeenagers_33.speaker: Youth Qun'irel
CorridorTeenagers_33.text: She's in her quarters, through those doors.

CorridorTeenagers_40.speaker: Player
CorridorTeenagers_40.text: I'm with the Inquisition. Tell me what you were gossiping about. Now.

CorridorTeenagers_25.speaker: Youth Tra'an
CorridorTeenagers_25.context: NodeContext: Clipped, formal - reporting to a more senior officer

CorridorTeenagers_27.speaker: Youth Qun'irel
CorridorTeenagers_27.text: We were only talking about what you already know. About the weapon. The one the kith'rak can't find.
CorridorTeenagers_27.context: NodeContext: Cracked under the pressure, desperate to get out of trouble

CorridorTeenagers_26.speaker: Youth Tra'an
CorridorTeenagers_26.text: Keep your mouth shut - you're going to get us in deep tsk'va.
CorridorTeenagers_26.context: InternalNodeContext: tsk-VA (means "shit")NodeContext: Urgent, almost hissed

CorridorTeenagers_8.speaker: Player
CorridorTeenagers_8.text: No, definitely don't keep your mouth shut - what else do you know?

CorridorTeenagers_32.speaker: Youth Qun'irel
CorridorTeenagers_32.text: The kith'rak is very worried about the ghaik threat. Before you came here, discovering what is happening in Moonrise Towers was our main focus.

CorridorTeenagers_23.speaker: Youth Qun'irel
CorridorTeenagers_23.text: We heard the kith'rak say... the Inquisition is wasting her time with this search for a weapon...

CorridorTeenagers_11.speaker: Youth Tra'an
CorridorTeenagers_11.text: We? Don't bring me into it - I know when to keep my mouth shut.

CorridorTeenagers_31.speaker: Player
CorridorTeenagers_31.text: You sound pretty afraid of the Inquisition - why?

CorridorTeenagers_42.speaker: Youth Tra'an
CorridorTeenagers_42.text: They're the darkness at the edge of Queen Vlaakith's light. It's easy to get... lost in their shadow.
CorridorTeenagers_42.context: NodeContext: Bitter, hushed - doesn't want to be overheard, "lost" implying killed, or disappear

CorridorTeenagers_3.speaker: Youth Tra'an
CorridorTeenagers_3.text: When they find the weapon, they'll go. And things here can be normal again.

CorridorTeenagers_41.speaker: Player
CorridorTeenagers_41.text: Who's in charge of the inquisition?

CorridorTeenagers_14.speaker: Player
CorridorTeenagers_14.text: Where can I find the other Inquisitors?

CorridorTeenagers_10.speaker: Youth Qun'irel
CorridorTeenagers_10.text: They're already searching for the weapon. You should report to Inquisitor W'wargaz first.

CorridorTeenagers_29.speaker: Youth Qun'irel
CorridorTeenagers_29.text: He's down the corridor in the eastern wing, on the other side of the captain's quarters.

CorridorTeenagers_0.speaker: Youth Qun'irel
CorridorTeenagers_0.text: It's like being watched over by Queen Vlaakith herself.

CorridorTeenagers_16.speaker: Youth Qun'irel
CorridorTeenagers_16.text: Why don't you try your pretence on the kith'rak? She's down the corridor in the east wing. I'm sure she'll enjoy the performance.
CorridorTeenagers_16.context: NodeContext: Still a bit scared of you, being helpful

CorridorTeenagers_4.speaker: Player
CorridorTeenagers_4.text: Tell me the Inquisition's purpose, or I'll make mince-pulp of you younglings.

CorridorTeenagers_9.speaker: Youth Qun'irel
CorridorTeenagers_9.text: The Inquisition are here on Queen Vlaakith's orders. They're searching for a weapon that could finally destroy the ghaik.
CorridorTeenagers_9.context: InternalNodeContext: Gayk (means "mind flayer")NodeContext: Hushed/fearful tone

CorridorTeenagers_12.speaker: Youth Tra'an
CorridorTeenagers_12.text: You think we're scared of your threats? They're nothing compared to the Inquisitor's wrath.

CorridorTeenagers_7.speaker: Youth Qun'irel
CorridorTeenagers_7.text: If you want to know more, speak to the kith'rak. But don't tell her we sent you.
CorridorTeenagers_7.context: NodeContext: Jumping in, scared but trying to help

CorridorTeenagers_5.speaker: Player
CorridorTeenagers_5.text: Why are the Inquisition here? Tell me, or I'll beat it out of you.

CorridorTeenagers_21.speaker: Youth Qun'irel
CorridorTeenagers_21.text: An istik? But - but - you can't be here! I can't be seen with you! The ch'r'ai -
CorridorTeenagers_21.context: CinematicNodeContext: Realises the player is listeningNodeContext: Panicked

CorridorTeenagers_13.speaker: Youth Tra'an
CorridorTeenagers_13.text: Qun'irel! The Inquisition have more to worry about than who you talk to in the corridors.
CorridorTeenagers_13.context: NodeContext: Snapping the name, then exasperated

CorridorTeenagers_24.speaker: Youth Qun'irel
CorridorTeenagers_24.text: The kith'rak will welcome news from beyond the crèche. Good news, at least.

PAD_FoodComment_0.speaker: Player
PAD_FoodComment_0.text: I always wondered what githyanki eat.

PAD_RulesPoster_0.speaker: Player
PAD_RulesPoster_0.text: They run a tight ship. Must be a horrible place to grow up.

AD_KidsFleeDormitory_0.speaker: Zel'i
AD_KidsFleeDormitory_0.text: A fight! Time to follow protocol...

PAD_DormitoryComment_0.speaker: Player
PAD_DormitoryComment_0.text: So githyanki sleep in beds too. How conventional.

AD_VlaakithPortraitVandalized_0.speaker: Narrator
AD_VlaakithPortraitVandalized_0.text: *This imperious portrait of the githyanki warrior queen seems somewhat less so when adorned with your embellishments.*

AD_MageHandKidLaughingAtPlayer_0.speaker: Zel'i
AD_MageHandKidLaughingAtPlayer_0.context: NodeContext: Thinks this is one of the most hilarious things she's ever seen; knew that a gremishka was going to jump out at the player

AD_MageHandKidLaughingAtPlayer_1.speaker: Zel'i
AD_MageHandKidLaughingAtPlayer_1.text: Look what you did, k'chakhi! Look!
AD_MageHandKidLaughingAtPlayer_1.context: NodeContext: Gloating; knew that a gremishka was going to jump out at the player

AD_CaptainGuardChatter_2.speaker: Raider Ahu'u'rag
AD_CaptainGuardChatter_2.text: Think the kith'rak will cheer up when we find it?

AD_CaptainGuardChatter_0.speaker: Raider Chy'raagh
AD_CaptainGuardChatter_0.text: I think we all will, when this pestilent search is finally over.

AD_CaptainGuardChatter_3.speaker: Raider Ahu'u'rag
AD_CaptainGuardChatter_3.text: Surely the kith'rak could go look herself, if it's so important?

AD_CaptainGuardChatter_6.speaker: Raider Chy'raagh
AD_CaptainGuardChatter_6.text: Feel free to suggest it. I'm sure she'll appreciate your input.

AD_CaptainGuardChatter_4.speaker: Raider Ahu'u'rag
AD_CaptainGuardChatter_4.text: They should have let me interrogate those cultists. I'd have loosened their tongues properly...

AD_CaptainGuardChatter_7.speaker: Raider Chy'raagh
AD_CaptainGuardChatter_7.text: I'm sure you would. Likely before they'd had the chance to say anything useful.

AD_CaptainGuardChatter_5.speaker: Raider Ahu'u'rag
AD_CaptainGuardChatter_5.text: Maybe things will be better when the ch'r'ai leaves.

AD_CaptainGuardChatter_1.speaker: Raider Chy'raagh
AD_CaptainGuardChatter_1.text: So long as he leaves with what he came for.
